question: Graph 3 shows the number of injuries and illnesses a corporation reported per 100 full-time workers from 2003 to 2011. The solid line is the regression line for the data. The dotted line connects the points for 2003 and 2011; it represents the average rate of change in reported injuries and illness over the eight-year period. <image 1> The least-squares regression line is least successful at predicting the number of injury and illness reports in ____________.
description:
The image is a graph titled "Injuries and Illness Reported per Year." It shows the number of injuries and illnesses reported per 100 full-time workers from 2003 to 2011. The y-axis represents the cases per 100 full-time workers, ranging from 3.0 to 5.5. The x-axis represents the years from 2003 to 2011.

There are two lines on the graph:
1. A solid line, which is the regression line for the data.
2. A dotted line, which connects the points for 2003 and 2011, representing the average rate of change in reported injuries and illness over the eight-year period.

The graph also includes data points (black dots) for each year from 2003 to 2011, showing the actual number of reported injuries and illnesses per 100 full-time workers for each year.

From the graph, it is clear that the regression line (solid line) does not perfectly align with all the data points. The point that deviates the most from the regression line is the one for the year 2009.
